alert.note: Alert for Anson; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 12 at 1:19PM EST until February 13 at 11:56AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Rocky River Near Norwood affecting Anson and Stanly Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rocky River Near Norwood. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Minor flood stage. There is significant overflow into adjacent pasture and lowlands. At 27.0 feet, The parking lot at the Anson County boat access on the will begin to flood * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM EST Sunday the stage was 24.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The river stage as of 1:00 PM EST is 24.6 feet and is still slowly rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.1 feet on 01/25/2010. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Thu Rocky River Norwood 20.0 24.6 Sun 1 pm EST 12.2 8.2 7.0 6.4 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 115 AM EST.
